intro: Silene sendtneri f. slavnicii, commonly known as the Slavonian catchfly, is a rare and striking plant characterized by its pink to purple flowers and hairy stems. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is native to specific regions in the Balkans, particularly in Serbia and Croatia. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered vulnerable and requires protection.
